subject: p11413236
History: -year-old female with substernal chest pain who is two-month out from a CABG.
Findings: The right Port-A-Cath reservoir projects over the right chest and is currently accessed the catheter tip ends in the lower SVC. There has been interval placement of sternotomy wires, which are intact. The heart size is within normal limits and the mediastinal hilar contours do not appear widened. Calcified AP window node again seen. The lungs demonstrate left bailar opacity which is more linear in configuration on the lateral view. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: Left costophrenic angle opacity, somewhat linear on the lateral view, more suggestive of atelectasis or scarring, less likely small focus of consolidation. No pleural effusion.
